metadata.Title: CVE-2023-23455 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: atm_tc_enqueue in net/sched/sch_atm.c in the Linux kernel through 6.1.4 allows attackers to cause a denial of service because of type confusion (non-negative numbers can sometimes indicate a TC_ACT_SHOT condition rather than valid classification results). Kyle Zeng discovered that the ATM VC queuing discipline implementation in the Linux kernel contained a type confusion vulnerability in some situations. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

notes.Note: sbeattie> the break entry, b0188d4dbe5f ("[NET_SCHED]: sch_atm: Lindent"), is likely incorrect, as it is just code format changes. rodrigo-zaiden> USN-5975-1 first publication included esm/xenial linux-gcp version 4.15.0-1146.162~16.04.1 by mistake, it got fixed in version 4.15.0-1147.163~16.04.1 as published in USN-6009-1.
